item.title: My Attempt at Building a Multi-GPU Cache Embedding Server with TEI and Qdrant
item.description:
Github repo: https://github.com/joe32140/tei-qdrant-cache

Before We Start

Serving an LLM-based embedding model with replicates over multiple GPUs on the same machine might sound trivial today (2025), but after my extensive search, there’s actually no one-click setup. Originally, I thought vLLM could easily fulfill my needs, or that SGLang could be an alternative if vLLM didn’t work. However, both libraries turned out to be either very limited to specific models or did not support request routing across multi-GPUs. Luckily, I encountered link and link, leading me to an Nginx load balancer setup. It also turned out that Hugging Face has its own text-embeddings-inference library, which provides seamless support for serving embedding models with pre-built Docker images. In this post, my goal was to create a robust system for serving text embeddings using Hugging Face’s text-embeddings-inference (TEI) server, specifically targeting multi-GPU setups and incorporating a mechanism to handle repeated requests efficiently â€“ essentially, building a smart caching layer.

item.title: Reproducibility Report of ModernBERT Models for Retrieval Tasks Using DPR
item.description:
Cross-posted here: https://api.wandb.ai/links/joe32140/zqs87nz3

Before We Start

As researchers from LightOn.AI and Answer.AI released the ModernBERT models (https://huggingface.co/papers/2412.13663 ), which are BERT models for 2024, I am interested to see its performance on retrieval tasks as mentioned in their paper, specifically with DPR. However, they have not released the model checkpoints for all experiments. I decided to finetune ModernBERT on the MSMACRO dataset by myself based on the provided training scripts.
